Using racemic alcohols as the substrate, the Ru-NHC@DON serves as a dehydrogenative oxidation catalyst to produce prochiral ketones, which are then asymmetrically converted to a series of chiral alcohols and chiral amines by immobilized enzymes. 115098 The cascade catalysis of core-shell CoW-MOF: Further intensified allylic oxidation of cyclohexene to 2-cyclohexene-1-one Peng Â Dong , Tingna Â Shao , Jiangpeng Â Xie , Xiaohui Â Zhang , Yang Â Xin , Xiaorui Â Wang , Yu Â Zhao and Guixian Â Li 115102 One-pot hydroformylation/hydrogenation of bio-renewable ( R )-carvone in a recyclable Rh-catalyzed aqueous biphasic medium: Targeting dual remote sites with a single catalyst RupaliÂ S.
